title: How to Make Fruit Filled Tortillas

steps.headline: Heat the tortillas in a conventional oven or in the microwave oven.
Choose the fruit you want to use.
steps.description: Prepare the fruit by peeling the fruit and then chopping into bite-size pieces.

steps.headline: Divide the chopped fruit equally between the 4 tortillas and spoon the fruit onto half of the tortilla.
Mix together the brown sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg in a small bowl.
Sprinkle the brown sugar mixture over the fruit.
Roll up the tortillas starting at the end where the chopped fruit is at.
Lay the fruit filled tortillas on an ungreased baking sheet.
Cut slits into the tortillas to allow steam to escape.
Brush with milk and sprinkle with additional sugar, if desired.
Let cool a few minutes before eating.
steps.description: You can also eat the tortillas when they are cool.

text: Heat the tortillas in a conventional oven or in the microwave oven.  Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Choose the fruit you want to use. Prepare the fruit by peeling the fruit and then chopping into bite-size pieces. Divide the chopped fruit equally between the 4 tortillas and spoon the fruit onto half of the tortilla.  Mix together the brown sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg in a small bowl.  Sprinkle the brown sugar mixture over the fruit.  Roll up the tortillas starting at the end where the chopped fruit is at.  Lay the fruit filled tortillas on an ungreased baking sheet.  Cut slits into the tortillas to allow steam to escape.  Brush with milk and sprinkle with additional sugar, if desired.  Bake 8 to 12 minutes.  Let cool a few minutes before eating. You can also eat the tortillas when they are cool.
